Star Wars: The Rise of Skywalker
Review: Incredible that despite my subzero expectations I’ve never felt so betrayed by a movie before. I sat through this, acutely insulted by every single meaningless action sequence segueing into another meaningless action sequence where everything is so!! important!! stakes!! things happening!! except nothing is really happening. It’s just a big chase sequence and I guess JJ Abrams thought no one would notice?The Last Jedi had a lot of interesting thoughts and I respect the way Rian Johnson tried to…

Movie: Scary Stories to Tell in the Dark

Review: Never have I left the cinema in such stupor that hours later I'm still dazed by what I'd experienced. Fucking wow.

Completely mesmerizing. There's something really unsettling but beautiful in how the overlayed images create patterns and swarms of lights, cars, people, alien merry-go-rounds just moving and morphing around.
Never have I left the cinema in such stupor that hours later I'm still dazed by what I'd experienced. Fucking wow.

Encounters at the End of the World

Review: Despite the seriousness of the subject matter, it's hard to take this film seriously, since it's made by a bunch of white people flying into a foreign culture with not even the slightest interest in getting to know said foreign culture.

Imagine eight strangers telling you about the same nightmare over and over again. The details change, but the story is over-all the same. And you sort of sympathize with them at first because they're obviously scared by this, but after listening to them yap about it for about 45 minutes, the sympathy runs out and all that's left is tedium.Unfortunately, this tedium goes on until the end. The film continues to recount the same stories for an additional 30…

Review: I liked it well enough when I watched it the first time, but I thought it'd be a long time before I'd re-watch it. And yet, here I am, not even a month later.

I understand the importance of Philadelphia in the context of its time. Making it safe and a bit sterile was necessary(?) to not scare off the straight audiences back then, but unfortunately that means it has aged pretty badly. I couldn't find an emotional connection to the film, probably because I've already seen The Normal Heart, which is vastly superior in dealing with the topic of AIDS as well as portraying someone suffering from it in gutwrenching detail. Then again,…
I liked it well enough when I watched it the first time, but I thought it'd be a long time before I'd re-watch it. And yet, here I am, not even a month later.

Movie: Neon Genesis Evangelion: The End of Evangelion

Review: Perfect in its simplicity. All it wants to do is put some military dudes against a big badass alien dude and see what happens, but it does so with finesse.The characters are perfectly calculated to be memorable by their one prop or catchphrase, the predator's appearance is kept scarce and effective, and to offset and enhance the relative silence of the movie, there is a nervous, pulse-pounding score.I have a good bit of nostalgia for Predator since, growing…
